assets.asset: The city of Beichuan, one of the most affected by the deadly earthquake. The city will never be rebuilt and will become a memorial to the 90 000 dead.

The dead bodies of three students in the rubles of Beichuan middle school. This school was one of the most hardly hit with 400 death. Poorly built schools have resulted in a high number of death among students. Subsequently allegations of corruptions surfaced. the governement has systematically hindered efforts to invetigate the quality of the school contsructions. Whistle blowers have been jailed and parents been asked to keep quiet.
A mother standing on the rubles of her daughter's school waiting while rescuers are unearthing dead bodies.
At Beichuan middle school the dead body of a student is taken away, his face covered with a school book.

Parents of dead students grieving. They have just arrived at the school and understood there is no chance for them to see their child alive. The father of a student in tears is showing the poor quality bricks used to build the school.Dead bodies of Beichuan middle school students have been lined up. They are being sprayed with disinfectant before being taken to a mass grave. The use of mass graves have made it difficult to keep an accurate account of the students death.To bury the many victims of Hongbai, soldiers have digged graves on the hills overlooking the city.

A man wandering through Beichuan in ruins, crying.
A survivor in tears, holding her baby, finds shelter and care with the Hong Kong Red Cross. The Chinese Government quickly after the earthquake allowed foreign aid and NGOs.

At the village of Luo Shui in the plain of Chengdu, inhabitants are receiving water and food from volunteers. The locals have survived for 3 days with one bottle of water each, before receiving aid from the outside. The earthquake triggered a huge solidarity movement throughout China.

A survivor from the earthquake is brought in by soldiers.The quick deployment of thousands of troops and the successful efforts of the army to save many lives have been widely praised. However the PLA earthquake relief efforts revealed some gaps mainly due to a bureaucratic chain of command.
Li Qing Song is being taken out of the building alive by a team of rescuers from Henan province. He has spent 104 hours buried under the debris of the workers club where the eartquake caught him.
Li Qing Song is being taken into an ambulance.

Back to life, back to QQ. 36 hours after his rescue and spending 4 days trapped in the debris of a collapsed building, Li Qing Song (right) his back with his family. He is chatting online with a net friend next to his brother (left) his aunt and his dad (behind).At Mianyang stadium, a temporary shelter for earthquake refugees from Beichuan, a woman is holding her baby. She, has been living in the stadium for 3 days. She along her husband and child have survived the earthquake, but have lost their house and work.

At Mianyang stadium, a temporary shelter for earthquake refugees from Beichuan, a woman is holding her baby. She, has been living in the stadium for 3 days. She along her husband and child have survived the earthquake, but have lost their house and work.A boxing ring inside Mianyang stadium has been turned into a temporary dormitory for Beichuan earthquake refugees. Up to 20 000 people have used the stadium as a refuge. The outbreak of diseases was successfully prevented. The earthquake left over 5 million people homeless.On the second day of the earthquake National mourning, Chengdu youth spontaneously demonstrate, walking around People's Square, shouting "China stand up, Sichuan stand up", waving Chinese and communist flags, and lifting their fists in the air.
